ERT_episodes.description: Concerns over executive overreach and institutional strain; populist pressures on judiciary.

recent_events.event: Supreme Court independence challenged by executive branch
Milei elected; emergency economic powers granted amid austerity push

ERT_episodes.description: Morales government concentrated executive power, packed judiciary, and bypassed term limits.
Post-election fraud claims led to Morales resignation and contested transitional government.

recent_events.event: Disputed election results and military-backed ousting of Morales
Arce government arrests opposition figures; rule of law concerns

ERT_episodes.description: Bolsonaro administration attacked courts, media, and electoral institutions; undermined civil liberties.

recent_events.event: Bolsonaro refuses to accept election results; supporters storm Congress and Supreme Court
January 8 rioters prosecuted; democratic resilience demonstrated
Mass protests over inequality; state of emergency declared
Constitutional referendum rejected; democratic debate continues

ERT_episodes.description: Ongoing violence against civil society leaders; selective rule of law enforcement.

recent_events.event: Security forces respond violently to anti-government protests
First leftist president Petro elected; polarization deepens
Strengthened anti-corruption measures and judicial independence reforms

ERT_episodes.description: One-party Communist state with no meaningful electoral competition or independent media.

recent_events.event: Largest anti-government protests since 1994; hundreds arrested
New constitution approved; opposition candidates barred from running
Peaceful transfer of power after disputed 2019 elections
Media freedom concerns; journalists self-censor

ERT_episodes.description: Correa government restricted press, concentrated power, and weakened judiciary independence.

recent_events.event: President Noboa dissolves National Assembly amid political crisis; snap elections held
Presidential candidate Villavicencio assassinated days before election

ERT_episodes.description: Bukele removed attorney general and judges, declared state of emergency, and expanded executive power without checks.

recent_events.event: Congress dismisses Supreme Court justices and attorney general on first day of session
State of emergency suspends due process rights; over 50,000 arrested
Bukele re-elected despite constitutional ban on consecutive terms

ERT_episodes.description: Corrupt elites dismantled anti-corruption commission (CICIG); prosecutors and judges persecuted.

recent_events.event: Guatemala expels UN anti-corruption commission CICIG
Arévalo wins presidency; incumbent government attempts to annul results
Arévalo inaugurated after months of legal obstruction by outgoing AG

ERT_episodes.description: Post-coup environment and Hernández era marked by judicial capture, drug ties, and electoral manipulation.

recent_events.event: Contested re-election of Hernández amid fraud allegations; protests suppressed
Castro elected; Hernández extradited to US on drug trafficking charges
Concerns about undue influence of former president Zelaya on current administration

ERT_episodes.description: AMLO and Sheinbaum governments weakened electoral authority, judiciary independence, and civilian oversight of military.

recent_events.event: Electoral authority (INE) budget slashed; independent leadership removed by Congress
Constitutional reform eliminates judicial independence; judges to be elected by popular vote
Sheinbaum wins with supermajority; military given expanded civilian roles

ERT_episodes.description: Ortega-Murillo consolidation: banned opposition parties, imprisoned candidates, expelled NGOs and clergy.

recent_events.event: All major opposition presidential candidates arrested before election
Catholic bishop and 222 political prisoners deported to United States
University of Central America shut down; Catholic orders expelled from country
Mass protests over copper mine contract force government to close mine
Mulino elected president after Martinelli conviction; democratic norms questioned

ERT_episodes.description: Colorado Party dominance, endemic corruption, and weak rule of law; controversial presidential removal in 2012.

recent_events.event: Peña elected; Colorado Party retains power amid corruption allegations
US sanctions ex-president Cartes for corruption and links to Hezbollah

ERT_episodes.description: Permanent political crisis: six presidents in five years, executive-legislative standoffs, self-coup attempt in 2022.

recent_events.event: President Castillo attempts self-coup; arrested hours later and impeached
Boluarte government declares state of emergency; 49 protesters killed
Congress moves to close Constitutional Tribunal; democratic erosion accelerates
First peaceful left-to-right power transfer in 15 years demonstrates democratic consolidation

ERT_episodes.description: Maduro regime dismantled democratic institutions, jailed opposition, rigged elections, triggered mass emigration of 7+ million.

recent_events.event: Maduro claims victory in presidential election; opposition produces evidence of widespread fraud
Widespread arrests of opposition members, civil society actors, and election witnesses post-election

ERT_episodes.description: Orbán's Fidesz party dismantled judicial independence, captured media, changed electoral rules, and hollowed out democratic checks over 14+ years.

recent_events.event: Fidesz wins supermajority again; EU withholds funds over rule-of-law concerns
Parliament passes constitutional amendments further limiting judicial review

ERT_episodes.description: PiS government packed Constitutional Tribunal, restricted judiciary, and curtailed media freedom; reversed by Tusk coalition in 2023.

recent_events.event: Tusk coalition wins elections; begins restoring judicial independence
Government attempts to retake public broadcasting; constitutional standoff with president

ERT_episodes.description: Vucic's SNS consolidated control over media, judiciary, and state resources; opposition boycotted 2020 elections.

recent_events.event: Mass protests over electoral fraud allegations in December election
Disputed parliamentary results; opposition demonstrators sustain months of protests

ERT_episodes.description: Erdoğan dismantled checks and balances, jailed journalists and opponents, and shifted to presidential system after 2016 coup attempt.

recent_events.event: Erdoğan wins re-election in runoff amid opposition's strongest challenge in two decades
Opposition CHP wins Istanbul and Ankara mayoral races; first major electoral loss for AKP since 2002

ERT_episodes.description: Georgian Dream government increased authoritarian tendencies; passed Russian-style 'foreign agents' law and cracked down on protests.

recent_events.event: Parliament passes 'foreign influence' law; EU suspends accession talks
Disputed election; weeks of mass pro-EU protests across Tbilisi

ERT_episodes.description: Lukashenko has ruled without democratic legitimacy since 1994; 2020 election stolen and mass protests violently suppressed.

recent_events.event: Fraudulent election; 35,000+ arrested during unprecedented mass protests
Belarus used as launchpad for Russian invasion of Ukraine; further isolation

ERT_episodes.description: Modi-led BJP government weakened minority rights, press freedom, and judicial independence while using state institutions against opponents.

recent_events.event: Rahul Gandhi's parliament seat stripped after conviction; opposition leaders arrested
BJP loses supermajority in general election; coalition government formed

ERT_episodes.description: Duterte's drug war killed thousands extrajudicially; media outlets shut down, ICC probe launched.

recent_events.event: Marcos Jr. wins presidency in landslide; Duterte-Marcos alliance forms
Split between Marcos and Sara Duterte; drug war legacy investigated

ERT_episodes.description: Jokowi era saw growing military role in civilian affairs, weakened KPK anti-corruption body, and criminalization of dissent.

recent_events.event: Prabowo wins presidency; dynastic politics as Jokowi's son runs as VP
Military allowed wider domestic law enforcement role by new law

ERT_episodes.description: Post-Arab Spring democratic transition, fragile but functioning.
President Saied suspended parliament in self-coup, rewrote constitution, and concentrated all power in presidency.

recent_events.event: New constitution approved in low-turnout referendum; checks and balances removed
Opposition leaders imprisoned; journalists arrested for social media posts

ERT_episodes.description: State capture under Zuma severely weakened institutions; Ramaphosa reforms partially restored governance.

recent_events.event: ANC loses majority for first time since 1994; forms Government of National Unity
Zuma's MK party surges; former president banned from running for parliament
Peaceful transfer of power as Mahama defeats Bawumia in presidential election

ERT_episodes.description: Norm erosion, polarization, January 6 Capitol attack, and anti-democratic rhetoric from major political actors raised sustained concerns.

recent_events.event: January 6 Capitol attack; Trump refuses to concede election results
Trump wins presidential election; executive power expansion begins
Mass firings of federal employees; DOGE dismantles oversight agencies
Trudeau resigns; Mark Carney wins Liberal leadership amid US tariff pressure

ERT_episodes.description: Netanyahu's judicial overhaul legislation sought to strip Supreme Court of power to review government actions.

recent_events.event: Mass protests against judicial reform; reserve soldiers refuse service
Gaza war overshadows domestic governance crisis; ICC arrest warrant issued for Netanyahu
